channel.title: CVE Feed for takanakui -- WP Mobile Menu – The Mobile-Friendly Responsive Menu
channel.description: The latest CVEs for takanakui -- WP Mobile Menu – The Mobile-Friendly Responsive Menu

item.title: CVE-2024-2508|2024-07-31T13:33:02.094Z -- takanakui -- wp%20mobile%20menu%20%E2%80%93%20the%20mobile-friendly%20responsive%20menu
item.description: The WP Mobile Menu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_menu_item_icon function in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.4.4. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add the '_mobmenu_icon' post meta to arbitrary posts with an arbitrary (but sanitized) value. NOTE: Version 2.8.4.4 contains a partial fix for this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-3987|2024-07-29T18:36:05.827Z -- takanakui -- wp%20mobile%20menu%20%E2%80%93%20the%20mobile-friendly%20responsive%20menu
item.description: The WP Mobile Menu – The Mobile-Friendly Responsive Menu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via image alt text in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-3987|2024-06-07T02:39:28.156Z -- takanakui -- wp%20mobile%20menu%20%E2%80%93%20the%20mobile-friendly%20responsive%20menu
item.description: The WP Mobile Menu – The Mobile-Friendly Responsive Menu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via image alt text in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2508|2024-07-31T08:30:07.781Z -- takanakui -- wp%20mobile%20menu%20%E2%80%93%20the%20mobile-friendly%20responsive%20menu
item.description: The WP Mobile Menu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_menu_item_icon function in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.4.4. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add the '_mobmenu_icon' post meta to arbitrary posts with an arbitrary (but sanitized) value. NOTE: Version 2.8.4.4 contains a partial fix for this vulnerability.
